Instrument.name: Radiation Assessment Detector
Instrument.description: The Radiation Assessment Detector (RAD) investigation is an investigation to detect and analyze the most biologically-significant energetic particle radiation on the Martian surface as a key element of the Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) mission. Fully characterizing and understanding the radiation environment on Mars is fundamental to quantitatively assessing the habitability of the planet, and is essential for future crewed Mars missions. RAD also addresses significant aspects of the MSL investigation, including the radiation effects on biological potential and past habitability, as well as keys to understanding the chemical alteration of the regolith due to impinging space radiation.
